titlestmt.titleproper: New York Sunday-School Association Board of Managers records 1865-1875
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: New York Sunday-School Association Board of Managers records

bioghist.p: The New York Sunday-School Association, a multi-denominational organization, was formed to assist New York area Sunday school superintendents and teachers to be more useful and effective. The Association included a missionary committee whose object was to encourage and extend mission work.

scopecontent.p: This is a volume of minutes of monthly meetings of the Board of Managers of the New York Sunday-School Association, 1865-1875. The minutes document routine business and reports from committees, including the Missionary Committee, the Ways and Means Committee, the Executive Committee, and the Committee on Nominations. There are also financial reports and expenses and records of the election of officers and members serving on various committees.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
